fr.reflexe.viewshell.api.themes

Interface IHttpTemplateFunction


  • @PluginService
public interface IHttpTemplateFunction
    Custom template functions that are designed for use within HTTP call processing can implement this interface and register the implementation as an OSGi service. Template systems can integrate these functions by tracking OSGi services.

    Template systems are not required to implement functions. The function may provide different names for different template systems.

    Functions that do not require access to the HTTP call context should instead implement ITemplateFunction.

    If multiple template functions are defined with identical names, then the template system should select the function to apply using the rules described in the class documentation for ITemplateFunction.

    Thread safety: implementations are required to be safe for concurrent read/write access. Immutability is preferred.

    Since:
    1.0
    Author:
    REFLEXE Technologies
    See Also:
    IHttpServiceCall

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static String KEY_HTTP_SERVICE_CALL
      The key used to pass a reference to the IHttpServiceCall when merging template data into a template file, when processing a request and generating a response.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      Object execute(IHttpServiceCall call, List<?> arguments)
      Invokes the function, from a template being used to process an HTTP call, with an argument list.
      String getName(String forTemplateSystemName)
      Gets the preferred name of the function, which can vary according to the name of the template system if necessary.

    • Field Detail

      • KEY_HTTP_SERVICE_CALL

        static final String KEY_HTTP_SERVICE_CALL
        The key used to pass a reference to the IHttpServiceCall when merging template data into a template file, when processing a request and generating a response.
        See Also:
        ITemplateData.put(String, Object), ITemplateFile.merge(ITemplateData, java.io.Writer)

    • Method Detail

      • getName

        String getName(String forTemplateSystemName)
        Gets the preferred name of the function, which can vary according to the name of the template system if necessary.
        Parameters:
        forTemplateSystemName - the name of the template system, which will be implementation-dependent.
        Returns:
        the function name as appropriate for the named template system. This can vary, but can also be constant. If null, empty, or containing unsupported characters, the template system may ignore this function and should log some debugging information to help resolve any such problem.
        Since:
        1.0

      • execute

        Object execute(IHttpServiceCall call,
               List<?> arguments)
        Invokes the function, from a template being used to process an HTTP call, with an argument list.
        Parameters:
        call - provides access to the HTTP service call context.
        arguments - list of arguments. May be empty. Where possible, the template system will provide "unwrapped" objects and not objects within system-specific wrappers.
        Returns:
        an object or null, as appropriate for the template.
        Since:
        1.0
